info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 28 at 11:46PM EDT until July 29 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN STEUBEN AND NORTHEASTERN DE KALB COUNTIES... At 1146 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hamilton, or 7 miles south of Angola, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Ashley, Hudson, Alvarado, Berlien, Long Lake, Metz, Pleasant Lake, Hamilton Lake, and Steubenville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 336 and 345. Interstate 80 in Indiana between mile markers 154 and 156. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
